meanings.definition: To remove a stain or blemish from (something)
meanings.sent1: She carefully destained the white shirt to make it spotless.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner destained the carpet, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent3: After a clumsy spill, she quickly destained the tablecloth before anyone noticed.
meanings.sent4: His apology destained the tarnished relationship between them.
meanings.sent5: The powerful detergent destained the stubborn marks effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To cleanse or purify (something) by removing stains
meanings.sent1: The maid destained the kitchen counter, making it shine.
meanings.sent2: Using a special solution, she destained the glassware for the party.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he could destain the world of all its problems with a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness destained the negativity in the office environment.
meanings.sent5: The rain destained the dusty car, revealing its true color.
